episodeTitle: Give Us Your Answer, Robin! The Straw Hats' Outcry!
episodeTitleJapanese: 答えろロビン！麦わら一味の叫び！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kotaero Robin! Mugiwara ichimi no sakebi!!
description: Franky uses his Coup de Boo technique to escape with Robin to a balcony at Enies Lobby. The Straw Hat crew assembles on the courthouse roof, and Luffy attempts to convince Robin to return to the crew despite her initial refusal. The episode builds toward the emotional climax of the Enies Lobby arc.

events.title: Franky's Coup de Boo Debut
events.description: Franky pretends to self-destruct by using his Coup de Boo technique, a powerful fart-based propulsion attack. He inflates his buttocks and releases all remaining cola power to blast himself and Robin through a window and onto the balcony, breaking his chains in the process.
events.significance: First appearance of Franky's comedic yet effective Coup de Boo technique. This escape allows Robin to see Luffy directly and sets up the emotional confrontation that follows.

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky tricking Spandam before using Coup de Boo

events.title: Franky and Robin Escape to Balcony
events.description: Using the momentum from Coup de Boo, Franky successfully propels himself and Robin out of the Tower of Justice and onto an external balcony. The explosion-like effect causes Spandam and the Marines to flee in fear, believing it to be a genuine self-destruct.
events.significance: This escape brings Robin into direct line of sight with Luffy for the first time since her capture, enabling the crucial conversation that follows.

events.title: Blueno's Defeat Confirmed
events.description: CP9 learns that Blueno has been defeated by Luffy. This shocks the other CP9 members and Spandam, as Blueno was considered one of their strongest members with his Doa Doa no Mi powers.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's growth in power and his new Gear Second abilities. The defeat of a CP9 member raises the stakes and shows the Straw Hats can compete with the World Government's elite.

quotes.text: Blueno was defeated? By Straw Hat Luffy?
quotes.speaker: Spandam

events.title: Robin Refuses Rescue
events.description: When Luffy calls out to Robin, she initially refuses rescue, telling them to stay away and expressing that she wants to die. This devastating response comes from Robin's trauma and belief that she brings only misfortune to those around her.
events.significance: This is a pivotal emotional moment that establishes Robin's internal conflict and her struggle with self-worth. It sets up the iconic 'I want to live' scene that follows in subsequent episodes.

quotes.text: I won't return. This isn't what I want. When did I ask you to rescue me?
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin initially refusing Luffy's rescue attempt

events.title: Nami and Chopper Blast Through Courthouse Ceiling
events.description: After defeating the Just Eleven Jurymen, Nami and Chopper are blown through the courthouse ceiling by an explosion, emerging dramatically onto the rooftop to join Luffy.
events.significance: Shows the Straw Hats' progression through Enies Lobby and their determination to reach Robin. Demonstrates their combat prowess against Enies Lobby's forces.

events.title: Zoro Climbs to the Courthouse Roof
events.description: Zoro makes his way up to the courthouse roof through his own path, joining Luffy, Nami, and Chopper in their confrontation with CP9.
events.significance: Shows the crew reuniting and assembling for their final stand at Enies Lobby.

events.title: Sanji Kicks Through the Roof
events.description: Sanji makes his own entrance by kicking a hole through the courthouse roof, joining his crewmates in their assembled position facing Robin.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's strength and determination. Adds to the dramatic buildup as the entire crew gathers.

events.title: Sogeking Thrown by Kashii
events.description: The giant Kashii throws Sogeking (Usopp) up to the courthouse roof, completing the assembly of all Straw Hat crew members. This dramatic entrance completes the team.
events.significance: Marks the complete assembly of the Straw Hat crew at Enies Lobby, symbolizing their unity and determination to save Robin. All members are now present for the confrontation.

events.title: Complete Straw Hat Crew Assembles on Courthouse Roof
events.description: All six Straw Hat Pirates present at Enies Lobby - Luffy, Zoro, Sanji, Nami, Chopper, and Sogeking - stand together on the courthouse roof, facing Robin and CP9 across the waterfall divide. This powerful visual moment represents the crew's united front.
events.significance: One of the most iconic visual moments in One Piece, showing the entire crew united in their determination to save Robin. This scene builds toward the emotional climax of the arc.

events.title: Just Eleven Jurymen Defeated
events.description: Nami and Chopper successfully defeat the Just Eleven Jurymen, the strongest troops under Baskerville's command at the Enies Lobby courthouse. These eleven condemned pirates who only say 'Guilty!' are overcome by the Straw Hats' teamwork.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' growing combat abilities and their progress through Enies Lobby's defenses.

quotes.speaker: Just Eleven Jurymen
quotes.context: The jurymen's repeated declaration during battle

events.title: Baskerville Revealed as Three People
events.description: The Three-Headed Baskerville is revealed to actually be three close friends - Bas, And, and Kerville - who prefer to act as one body. As Chief Justice of Enies Lobby, he commands the courthouse forces.
events.significance: Introduces one of the unique character designs in the Enies Lobby arc and establishes the courthouse's defensive structure.

quotes.text: We are Baskerville, Chief Justice of Enies Lobby!
quotes.speaker: Baskerville
quotes.context: Baskerville introducing himself to the Straw Hats

events.title: Oimo and Kashii Stop the Marines
events.description: The giants Oimo and Kashii actively block the Marines from advancing, stating they still have a grudge against the Marines for lying to them about their captains for 50 years. They've now allied with the Straw Hats and their forces.
events.significance: Shows the consequences of the World Government's deception and how the giants have switched allegiances to help the Straw Hats. Demonstrates the growing coalition against CP9.

quotes.text: We still have a beef with you Marines who made us waste 50 years by lying to us!
quotes.speaker: Oimo
quotes.context: Oimo explaining why they're blocking the Marines

events.title: CP9 Members Assemble on Tower of Justice
events.description: The CP9 members - Rob Lucci, Kaku, Kalifa, Jabra, Fukurou, Kumadori - gather alongside Spandam on the Tower of Justice balcony, facing the assembled Straw Hats across the waterfall. The two groups face each other in a tense standoff.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battles between the Straw Hats and CP9. This visual confrontation represents the clash between the Straw Hats and the World Government's elite forces.

events.title: Luffy's Unconditional Support
events.description: In response to Robin's refusal and her saying she wants to die, Luffy doesn't try to convince her otherwise. Instead, he tells her that if she wants to say those things, she should say them by their side. He declares they will rescue her first, then she can decide her fate.
events.significance: This moment showcases Luffy's unique approach to friendship and leadership. Rather than arguing with Robin's feelings, he offers unconditional support and acceptance, which becomes crucial in breaking through Robin's emotional barriers.

quotes.text: Go ahead and say you want to die, or something. But say those things by our side!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's response to Robin's refusal, offering unconditional support

events.title: Spandam's Cruel Enjoyment
events.description: Spandam takes sadistic pleasure in watching the Straw Hats' apparent emotional breakdown as Robin refuses them. He enjoys the sight of their pain, showcasing his cruel and petty nature.
events.significance: Further establishes Spandam as a despicable villain and contrasts his cruelty with the genuine friendship shown by the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Look at them suffer! This is wonderful!
quotes.speaker: Spandam
quotes.context: Spandam enjoying the Straw Hats' apparent pain

events.title: Luffy Picks His Nose
events.description: While Spandam expects to see Luffy in emotional distress over Robin's refusal, Luffy is instead casually picking his nose, showing his confidence and lack of concern about Robin's temporary rejection.
events.significance: A comedic moment that demonstrates Luffy's unshakeable faith in his ability to save Robin and his understanding that her refusal comes from pain, not genuine desire.

quotes.text: I won't return. This isn't what I want. When did I ask you to rescue me?
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin initially refusing Luffy's rescue attempt

quotes.text: Go ahead and say you want to die, or something. But say those things by our side!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's response to Robin, offering unconditional support

quotes.text: Blueno was defeated? By Straw Hat Luffy?
quotes.speaker: Spandam

quotes.text: We still have a beef with you Marines who made us waste 50 years by lying to us!
quotes.speaker: Oimo
quotes.context: Oimo explaining why the giants are blocking the Marines

quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky tricking Spandam before using Coup de Boo

themes.description: Luffy's response to Robin's refusal demonstrates the core theme of unconditional acceptance and support. Rather than trying to change Robin's feelings, he offers to rescue her regardless of her decision.
themes.symbolism: The physical divide between the courthouse and Tower of Justice represents Robin's emotional distance from the crew, which must be bridged through genuine understanding and support.

themes.description: Robin's refusal stems from deep-seated trauma and feelings of unworthiness. She believes she brings misfortune to those who care about her, reflecting her experiences since childhood.
themes.symbolism: Robin's position on the Tower of Justice with CP9 symbolizes how she has imprisoned herself emotionally, unable to accept help or love from others.

themes.description: The assembly of all Straw Hats on the courthouse roof, along with their allies like the giants, represents a united front against the oppressive forces of the World Government.
themes.symbolism: The complete crew standing together creates a powerful visual representation of their unity and collective strength.

themes.description: The giants Oimo and Kashii's betrayal of the Marines showcases how the World Government's lies and manipulation eventually backfire, creating enemies instead of allies.
themes.symbolism: The giants physically blocking the Marines represents how truth eventually overcomes deception.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin's internal conflict reaches its peak as she verbally refuses rescue despite seeing her crew assembled to save her. Her trauma and self-destructive thoughts are laid bare.
keyActions: Sees the assembled Straw Hat crew
Refuses rescue and expresses desire to die
quotes: I won't return. This isn't what I want. When did I ask you to rescue me?

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates his unique approach to leadership and friendship by offering Robin unconditional support rather than arguing with her feelings. His response shows emotional maturity and deep understanding.
keyActions: Stands with assembled crew on courthouse roof
Responds to her refusal with unconditional acceptance
Declares they will rescue her regardless
quotes: Go ahead and say you want to die, or something. But say those things by our side!

characterSpotlights.development: Franky shows his ingenuity and combat creativity by using his Coup de Boo technique to escape with Robin, demonstrating both his tactical thinking and his commitment to helping her.
keyActions: Uses Coup de Boo to escape with Robin
Gets Robin into position to see Luffy

characterSpotlights.development: Spandam's cruel enjoyment of Robin's and the Straw Hats' suffering further establishes him as a despicable villain, contrasting sharply with the genuine bonds of friendship shown by the protagonists.
keyActions: Orders CP9 to guard the drawbridge
Takes pleasure in Robin's refusal of rescue
quotes: Blueno was defeated? By Straw Hat Luffy?
Look at them suffer! This is wonderful!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the sequence of each Straw Hat arriving on the courthouse roof, giving more time and dramatic weight to each member's entrance.
The CP9 members' reactions to Blueno's defeat were expanded in the anime with additional dialogue and facial expressions.
Franky's Coup de Boo sequence was more elaborately animated with enhanced comedic timing compared to the manga panels.

trivia.fact: Episode 274 is one of the last episodes to feature an ending song, as the anime stopped using ending themes after Episode 279 to extend episode runtime.
This episode has a 9.4/10 rating on IMDb, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the Enies Lobby arc, reflecting the emotional impact of the Straw Hats' assembly and Luffy's speech to Robin.
The episode aired in Japan with a 10.1% viewership rating, ranking 3rd in its time slot, showing the arc's popularity at the time.

Coup de Boo is one of Franky's most memorable comedic techniques, using flatulence as propulsion. The name is a pun combining 'coup de' (French for 'blow of') with 'boo' (Japanese onomatopoeia for farting).

sources.title: Franky/Abilities and Powers - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 274 adapts manga Chapter 389 (pages 2-19) and Chapter 390 (pages 2-19), maintaining a relatively faithful 2-chapter adaptation pace.
The Just Eleven Jurymen are a unique concept in One Piece - convicted pirates who serve as Enies Lobby's troops, only allowed to say 'Guilty!' as they take other pirates to execution.

sources.title: Just Eleven Jurymen - One Piece Wiki
